Generation I.Red: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000-volt lightning bolts.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000-volt lightning bolts.
Generation I.Yellow: A sensitive Pok é mon that easily becomes sad or angry. Every time its mood changes, it charges power.
Generation I.Stadium: Its weapons are its 10,000-volt electric attacks and its spiky fur. Its sharp hair can pierce enemies when it bristles.

Generation II.Gold: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.
Generation II.Silver: Every hair on its body starts to stand sharply on end if it becomes charged with electricity.
Generation II.Crystal: The negatively charged ions generated in its fur create a constant sparking noise.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Every hair on its body starts to stand sharply on end if it becomes charged with electricity. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Jolteon 's cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the Pok é mon to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
Generation III.Sapphire: Jolteon 's cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the Pok é mon to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
Generation III.Emerald: Its cells generate weak power that is amplified by its fur's static electricity to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
Generation III.FireRed: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

Generation IV.Diamond: It controls 10,000-volt power and can raise all the fur on its body as if it were sharp needles.
Generation IV.Pearl: It controls 10,000-volt power and can raise all the fur on its body as if it were sharp needles.
Generation IV.Platinum: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Every hair on its body starts to stand sharply on end if it becomes charged with electricity.

Generation V.Black: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.
Generation V.White: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.
Generation V.Black 2: By storing electricity in its body, it can shoot its bristlelike fur like a barrage of missiles.
Generation V.White 2: By storing electricity in its body, it can shoot its bristlelike fur like a barrage of missiles.

Generation VI.X: Every hair on its body starts to stand sharply on end if it becomes charged with electricity.
Generation VI.Y: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Jolteon's cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the Pokémon to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Jolteon's cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the Pokémon to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.

Generation VII.Sun: They send out electrical charges of about 10,000 volts. Because they are high-strung, it can be difficult to grow close to them.
Generation VII.Moon: When its fur stands on end, that's a sign it's about to give off a jolt of electricity. Take care, as sometimes lightning strikes next to it, too.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its lungs contain an organ that creates electricity. The crackling sound of electricity can be heard when it exhales.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its fur stands on end, becoming like needles it fires at enemies. Once they're weakened, it finishes them off with a 10,000 volt shock.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: A sensitive Pokémon that easily becomes sad or angry. Every time its mood changes, it charges power.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: A sensitive Pokémon that easily becomes sad or angry. Every time its mood changes, it charges power.

Generation VIII.Sword: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.
Generation VIII.Shield: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It controls 10,000-volt power. When the fur covering its body stands on end, the fur is hard and sharp, like needles.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It controls 10,000-volt power. When the fur covering its body stands on end, the fur is hard and sharp, like needles.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Bristles its fur into sharp, needlelike points when enraged. One can hear electricity crackle in its breath when it exhales.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.
Generation IX.Violet: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.
